meanings.definition: Of special importance, ability, or influence; or, particularly tall physically.
examples: She towered over the rest of the class in math.

images.alt: Photo of a town with one, very high column or tower.
images.description: Photo of a town with one, very high column or tower.
images.caption: This tall column is towering over the rest of the city.

source.title: Shallow Focus Photo of Brown Building
source.author: Emre Kuzu

meanings.definition: To discover something after a search.
examples: The searchers found the missing children on the subway train.

images.alt: Photo of a person looking through binoculars.
images.description: Photo of a man looking through binoculars at sunset.
images.caption: Binoculars are a good tool to use when you want to find something far away.

source.title: Man Looking in Binoculars during Sunset
source.author: Francis Seura

examples: Today, many stores sell locally grown fruits and vegetables.

images.alt: Photo of a market with vegetables.
images.caption: A farmer's market selling fresh vegetables that are grown near by.

meanings.definition: A sense of personal value that comes from what one has or can do.
examples: He takes pride in his work.

images.alt: Photo of two people jumping, seen in silhouette.
images.description: Two people jumping with hands extended upward, expressing excitement. They are seen in silhouette.
images.caption: You may jump for joy when you are very proud of something you did.

source.title: Two Person Standing in Silhouette Photography
source.author: Jill Wellington
